name: Barbell Back Squat
notes: The king of all leg exercises. Targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes while building immense core stability.

name: Barbell Bench Press
notes: The primary upper body mass builder. Focuses on pectorals, anterior deltoids, and triceps with heavy load potential.

name: Conventional Deadlift
notes: A total body power movement that primarily hits the posterior chain (back, glutes, hamstrings) and grip strength.

name: Standing Military Press
notes: The gold standard for shoulder strength. Targets all deltoid heads and relies heavily on core stabilization.

name: One Arm Dumbbell Row
notes: Unilateral back builder that allows for a deep stretch and heavy loading to thicken the lats and rhomboids.

name: Wide Grip Lat Pulldown
notes: Essential machine movement for building back width. Targets the latissimus dorsi with a vertical pulling motion.

name: 45 Degree Leg Press
notes: Machine-based compound leg movement allowing you to overload the quads and hamstrings safely.

name: Seated Cable Row
notes: Horizontal pulling movement that targets the mid-back thickness, lower traps, and rhomboids.

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
notes: Upper chest specialist. The incline angle recruits the clavicular head of the pecs more effectively.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
notes: Isolation movement critical for capping the shoulders. Specifically targets the medial deltoid for width.

name: Cable Tricep Pushdown
notes: Isolation exercise for the triceps. Uses constant tension from the cable to define the back of the arm.

name: Standing Barbell Curl
notes: The classic mass builder for biceps. Allows for heavy loading to build peak and thickness in the arms.

name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
notes: Dynamic unilateral leg exercise. Excellent for glute development and balance.

name: Romanian Deadlift
notes: Hip-hinge movement that isolates the hamstrings and glutes. Crucial for posterior chain health.

name: Leg Extension
notes: Isolation machine exercise that specifically targets the quadriceps. Great for finishing a leg workout.

name: Lying Leg Curl
notes: Direct hamstring isolation. Essential for knee health and balancing quad dominance.

name: Standing Calf Raise
notes: Isolation movement for the gastrocnemius. Constant tension is key for lower leg development.

name: Cable Face Pull
notes: Rear delt and rotator cuff builder. Critical for shoulder health and posture correction.

name: Plank
notes: Isometric core hold. Builds endurance in the transversus abdominis and stabilizes the spine.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
notes: Advanced core movement targeting the lower abdominals and hip flexors through spinal flexion.

name: Cable Woodchopper
notes: Rotational core exercise. Mimics functional athletic movements and targets the obliques.

name: Power Clean
notes: Explosive triple-extension movement. Builds athletic power, speed, and overall neural drive.

name: Box Jump
notes: Plyometric exercise for explosive leg power. Improves fast-twitch muscle fiber recruitment.

name: Smith Machine Squat
notes: Fixed-path squat variation. Allows you to focus purely on driving the weight without stabilizing.

name: Smith Machine Shrug
notes: Trapezius builder. The fixed path allows for extremely heavy loading for neck and back thickness.

name: Machine Pec Deck
notes: Isolation movement for the chest. Removes tricep involvement to fully stretch and contract the pecs.

name: Treadmill HIIT Sprints
notes: High-intensity interval training. Alternating sprints and rest to maximize calorie burn.

name: Concept 2 Rowing
notes: Full-body cardiovascular conditioning. Uses legs, back, and arms for a low-impact burn.

name: Stationary Bike Intervals
notes: Low-impact cardio focusing on leg endurance and cardiovascular health without joint stress.

name: Cat-Cow Stretch
notes: Spinal mobility flow. Essential for warming up the spine and improving posture.

name: Doorway Pec Stretch
notes: Chest opener. Stretches the pectorals to combat rounded shoulders from desk work.

name: Pigeon Stretch
notes: Deep hip opener. Targets the glutes and piriformis to release tight hips.

name: Dips
notes: Builds mass in the chest and triceps while demanding shoulder stability.

name: Pull Up
notes: The definitive bodyweight back builder. Targets the lats for width and upper back strength.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
notes: A brutal unilateral leg exercise. Isolates each quad and glute to fix imbalances.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
notes: The best movement for pure glute hypertrophy. Shortens the glute muscle fully under load.

name: EZ Bar Skullcrusher
notes: Isolation movement for the long head of the tricep. Essential for adding size to the arm.

name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
notes: Neutral grip curl. Targets the brachialis and forearm extensors for arm thickness.

name: Arnold Press
notes: Shoulder press variation with rotation. Hits all three deltoid heads.

name: T-Bar Row
notes: Old-school thickness builder. Allows for heavy weight to be moved using the entire back.

name: Machine Hack Squat
notes: Stabilized squat variation. Takes the back out of the equation to load the quads.

name: Smith Machine Incline Press
notes: Upper chest builder. The fixed path allows you to safely grind out reps.

name: Stair Climber
notes: Functional cardio. Builds work capacity while actively engaging the glutes and calves.

name: Assault Air Bike
notes: Total body metabolic conditioning. The resistance increases as you push harder.

name: Ab Wheel Rollout
notes: Anti-extension core movement. Effective for deep core strength and abdominal definition.

name: Weighted Russian Twist
notes: Rotational core movement. Targets the obliques and improves rotational control.

name: Cable Crossover
notes: Chest isolation. Provides constant tension at the peak contraction of the chest.

name: Farmer's Walk
notes: Functional carry. Builds iron grip strength, huge traps, and bulletproofs the core.

name: World's Greatest Stretch
notes: Total body mobility flow. Opens the hips, t-spine, and hamstrings in one movement.

name: Foam Rolling (SMR)
notes: Self-Myofascial Release. Essential for tissue quality and recovery.

name: Push up
notes: Bodyweight chest builder. Targets the pectorals, anterior deltoids, and triceps.

name: Bodyweight Squat
notes: Bodyweight leg builder. Targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes while building core stability.

name: Bodyweight Lunge
notes: Bodyweight leg builder. Targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes while building core stability.

name: Dumbbell Step Up
notes: Bodyweight leg builder. Targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes while building core stability.

name: Bodyweight Glute Bridge
notes: Bodyweight leg builder. Targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes while building core stability.

name: Bodyweight Squat Jump
notes: Bodyweight leg builder. Targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes while building core stability.
